title: Awesome List Updates on Apr 02, 2019
_seo_title: Awesome List Updates on Apr 02, 2019 - Track Awesome List

items.title: Awesome Ruby
items.content_text:
### Debugging Tools

*   [pry-rails (‚≠ê1.4k)](https://github.com/rweng/pry-rails) - Avoid repeating yourself, use pry-rails instead of copying the initializer to every rails project. This is a small gem which causes rails console to open pry. It therefore depends on pry.
items.content_html:
Debugging Tools

  • pry-rails (‚≠ê1.4k) - Avoid repeating yourself, use pry-rails instead of copying the initializer to every rails project. This is a small gem which causes rails console to open pry. It therefore depends on pry.

items.title: Awesome Mqtt
items.content_text:
### Messaging / Firmwares for ESP based Devices

*   [mqttwarn (‚≠ê971)](https://github.com/jpmens/mqttwarn) - Subscribe to MQTT topics (with wildcards) and notify pluggable services.

### Visualization, Dashboards / Firmwares for ESP based Devices

*   [d3-MQTT-Topic-Tree (‚≠ê98)](https://github.com/hardillb/d3-MQTT-Topic-Tree) - A MQTT Topic Tree viewer using the d3 collapsible tree and MQTT over websockets.
items.content_html:
Messaging / Firmwares for ESP based Devices

  • mqttwarn (‚≠ê971) - Subscribe to MQTT topics (with wildcards) and notify pluggable services.

Visualization, Dashboards / Firmwares for ESP based Devices

items.title: Awesome Vulkan

items.title: Awesome Linguistics
items.content_text:
### Platforms and toolkits

*   [UralicNLP (‚≠ê81)](https://github.com/mikahama/uralicNLP) - An open source Python library for processing morphologically rich and, for the most part, endangered Uralic languages. It can do morphological analysis, generation, lemmatization, disambiguation and lexical lookup for a great many Uralic languages.
items.content_html:
Platforms and toolkits

  • UralicNLP (‚≠ê81) - An open source Python library for processing morphologically rich and, for the most part, endangered Uralic languages. It can do morphological analysis, generation, lemmatization, disambiguation and lexical lookup for a great many Uralic languages.

items.title: Awesome React Native
items.content_text:
### Seeds / Navigation Demos

*   [react-native-vanilla ‚òÖ185 (‚≠ê1.9k)](https://github.com/pavjacko/react-native-vanilla) - üöÄüöÄüöÄ Build universal cross-platform apps with React Native. Includes latest `iOS`, `tvOS`, `Android`, `Android TV`, `Android Wear`, `Web`, `Tizen TV`, `Tizen Watch`, `LG webOS`, `macOS/OSX`, `Windows` and `KaiOS` platforms
items.content_html:

items.title: Awesome Cross Platform Nodejs
items.content_text:
### Applications / Continuous integration

*   [AppVeyor](http://www.appveyor.com/) - Focused on Windows. Free tiers are available for OSS projects.

### Applications / Virtualization

*   [ievms (‚≠ê68)](https://github.com/amichaelparker/ievms) - Automated installer for the free virtual machine images that Microsoft provides for testing on multiple versions of IE. These images can be useful for cross-platform testing various technologies, however make sure you read and understand Microsofts' licensing.

### Applications / Compatibility

*   [MinGW](http://www.mingw.org/) - `gcc` on Windows.
*   [msys](http://www.mingw.org/wiki/msys) / [Git Bash](https://gitforwindows.org/) - Bash on Windows.

### Libraries / OS identification

*   [is-wsl (‚≠ê190)](https://github.com/sindresorhus/is-wsl) - Detect whether current platform is WSL (Windows Subsystem for Linux).
*   [os-name (‚≠ê147)](https://github.com/sindresorhus/os-name) - Get the name of the current operating system.
*   [systeminformation (‚≠ê2.9k)](https://github.com/sebhildebrandt/systeminformation) - Hardware/software system information.

### Libraries / Shell

*   [cross-spawn (‚≠ê1.1k)](https://github.com/IndigoUnited/node-cross-spawn) - Cross-platform implementation of `child_process.spawn()`.
*   [shelljs (‚≠ê14k)](https://github.com/shelljs/shelljs) - Cross-platform Unix shell commands.
*   [node-windows (‚≠ê2.9k)](https://github.com/coreybutler/node-windows) - Windows support for Node.js scripts (daemons, eventlog, UAC, etc).
*   [clipboardy (‚≠ê1.8k)](https://github.com/sindresorhus/clipboardy) / [clipboard-cli (‚≠ê501)](https://github.com/sindresorhus/clipboard-cli) - Cross-platform copy/paste.

### Libraries / Environment

*   [cross-env (‚≠ê6.4k)](https://github.com/kentcdodds/cross-env) - Set environment variables cross-platform.
*   [user-home (‚≠ê160)](https://github.com/sindresorhus/user-home) - Get the path to the user home directory. Cross-platform.
*   [username (‚≠ê143)](https://github.com/sindresorhus/username) - Get the current username.
*   [osenv (‚≠ê137)](https://github.com/npm/osenv) - Cross-platform environment variables.
*   [is-elevated (‚≠ê41)](https://github.com/sindresorhus/is-elevated) - Check if the process is running with elevated privileges.
*   [which (‚≠ê339)](https://github.com/npm/node-which) - Cross-platform implementation of Unix's `which`.

### Libraries / Filesystem

*   [rimraf (‚≠ê5.8k)](https://github.com/isaacs/rimraf) / [del (‚≠ê1.3k)](https://github.com/sindresorhus/del) - Delete files and folders. Cross-platform.
*   [make-dir (‚≠ê478)](https://github.com/sindresorhus/make-dir) - Cross-platform `mkdir -p`.
*   [readdirp (‚≠ê387)](https://github.com/paulmillr/readdirp) - Recursive version of `fs.readdir()`.
*   [graceful-fs (‚≠ê1.3k)](https://github.com/isaacs/node-graceful-fs) - Improves the `fs` module, especially on Windows.
*   [any-path (‚≠ê4)](https://github.com/bcoe/any-path) - Use Windows and POSIX paths interchangeably when fetching values from an object.

### Libraries / Signals

*   [signal-exit (‚≠ê192)](https://github.com/tapjs/signal-exit) - Cross-platform `exit` handler.

### Libraries / Processes

*   [ps-list (‚≠ê276)](https://github.com/sindresorhus/ps-list) - Get running processes.
*   [process-exists (‚≠ê58)](https://github.com/sindresorhus/process-exists) - Check if a process exists.

### Libraries / Desktop UI

*   [open (‚≠ê3.3k)](https://github.com/sindresorhus/open) - Opens stuff like websites, files, executables. Cross-platform.
*   [node-notifier (‚≠ê5.8k)](https://github.com/mikaelbr/node-notifier) - Cross-platform desktop notifications.

### Libraries / Windows registry

*   [node-winreg (‚≠ê213)](https://github.com/fresc81/node-winreg) - Access the Windows registry.
*   [rage-edit (‚≠ê54)](https://github.com/MikeKovarik/rage-edit) - Access/modify the Windows registry.
items.content_html:
Applications / Continuous integration

  • AppVeyor - Focused on Windows. Free tiers are available for OSS projects.

Applications / Virtualization

  • ievms (‚≠ê68) - Automated installer for the free virtual machine images that Microsoft provides for testing on multiple versions of IE. These images can be useful for cross-platform testing various technologies, however make sure you read and understand Microsofts' licensing.

Applications / Compatibility

  • MinGW - gcc on Windows.
  • msys / Git Bash - Bash on Windows.

Libraries / OS identification

  • is-wsl (‚≠ê190) - Detect whether current platform is WSL (Windows Subsystem for Linux).
  • os-name (‚≠ê147) - Get the name of the current operating system.
  • systeminformation (‚≠ê2.9k) - Hardware/software system information.

Libraries / Shell

  • cross-spawn (‚≠ê1.1k) - Cross-platform implementation of child_process.spawn().
  • shelljs (‚≠ê14k) - Cross-platform Unix shell commands.
  • node-windows (‚≠ê2.9k) - Windows support for Node.js scripts (daemons, eventlog, UAC, etc).
  • clipboardy (‚≠ê1.8k) / clipboard-cli (‚≠ê501) - Cross-platform copy/paste.

Libraries / Environment

  • cross-env (‚≠ê6.4k) - Set environment variables cross-platform.
  • user-home (‚≠ê160) - Get the path to the user home directory. Cross-platform.
  • username (‚≠ê143) - Get the current username.
  • osenv (‚≠ê137) - Cross-platform environment variables.
  • is-elevated (‚≠ê41) - Check if the process is running with elevated privileges.
  • which (‚≠ê339) - Cross-platform implementation of Unix's which.

Libraries / Filesystem

  • rimraf (‚≠ê5.8k) / del (‚≠ê1.3k) - Delete files and folders. Cross-platform.
  • make-dir (‚≠ê478) - Cross-platform mkdir -p.
  • readdirp (‚≠ê387) - Recursive version of fs.readdir().
  • graceful-fs (‚≠ê1.3k) - Improves the fs module, especially on Windows.
  • any-path (‚≠ê4) - Use Windows and POSIX paths interchangeably when fetching values from an object.

Libraries / Signals

  • signal-exit (‚≠ê192) - Cross-platform exit handler.

Libraries / Processes

  • ps-list (‚≠ê276) - Get running processes.
  • process-exists (‚≠ê58) - Check if a process exists.

Libraries / Desktop UI

  • open (‚≠ê3.3k) - Opens stuff like websites, files, executables. Cross-platform.
  • node-notifier (‚≠ê5.8k) - Cross-platform desktop notifications.

Libraries / Windows registry

  • node-winreg (‚≠ê213) - Access the Windows registry.
  • rage-edit (‚≠ê54) - Access/modify the Windows registry.
